results.adx_keywords: Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Florida
results.title: Tropical Storm Ian Could Hit Florida as a Major Hurricane
results.abstract: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida declared a state of emergency for the entire state ahead of the storm, which is expected to strengthen and could develop into a Category 3 hurricane by next week.

media.caption: A Fort Myers, Fla., resident fills sand bags at a distribution site on Saturday in anticipation of the arrival of Ian.
media.copyright: Andrew West/The News-Press, via USA Today Network

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Pujols, Albert;Bonds, Barry;Ruth, Babe;Aaron, Hank;St Louis Cardinals;Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim
results.title: With His 700th Homer, Albert Pujols Gives Us One Last Surprise
results.abstract: A farewell tour turned into a showcase for Pujols, the veteran Cardinals slugger, as he joined the most exclusive of home run clubs long after many had written him off.

media.caption: Albert Pujols hit his 699th and 700th career home runs in the third and fourth innings of Friday’s game between the St. Louis Cardinals and the Los Angeles Dodgers.
media.copyright: Gary A. Vasquez/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Evangelical Movement;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Conservatism (US Politics);audio-neutral-informative;United States

results.title: The Pastors Being Driven Out by Trumpism
results.abstract: Why some evangelical pastors in the U.S. are quitting in large numbers.

results.adx_keywords: War and Armed Conflicts;Elections;Defense and Military Forces;Firearms;Assaults;Putin, Vladimir V;Kherson (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: In Ukraine’s South, Fierce Fighting and Deadly Costs
results.abstract: The offensive in the south was the most highly anticipated military action of the summer. Ukraine is making gains, but the fighting is grinding, grueling and steep in casualties.

media.caption: Ukrainian soldiers at an entrenched position this month near the Kherson front.
media.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Political Advertising;Political Action Committees;Campaign Finance;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party
results.title: Amid G.O.P. Cash Crunch, One Very Flush Ally May Soon Share the Wealth
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump, sitting on a huge campaign war chest, is eyeing a raft of television ads to help Republican candidates in the midterm elections, people familiar with the talks say.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s political committee, Save America, has raised $124 million since last year.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Attorneys General;Mold;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Kushner, Jared;Trump, Donald J;Kushner Cos;Maryland;Baltimore (Md)
results.title: Kushner’s Company Reaches $3.25 Million Settlement in Maryland Lawsuit
results.abstract: The apartment company charged illegal fees and failed to adequately address leaks, mold and rodent infestations in its properties, the Maryland attorney general said.

media.caption: The company owned by Jared Kushner violated consumer protection laws by charging tenants illegal fees and failed to adequately maintain its properties, the 2019 lawsuit alleged.

results.adx_keywords: Capital Punishment;Decisions and Verdicts;Miller, Alan Eugene;Supreme Court (US);Alabama
results.title: Supreme Court Says Alabama Can Kill Prisoner With Method He Fears
results.abstract: Prison officials tried to insert an I.V. line for Alan Eugene Miller’s execution, but had to halt before his death warrant expired at midnight. The state said the execution would be rescheduled.

media.caption: The lethal injection chamber at the William C. Holman Correctional Facility in Atmore, Ala., in 2002.

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Influenza;Content Type: Service
results.title: Can you get the flu shot and the new booster at the same time?
results.abstract: Combining vaccines may be more convenient, experts said.

media.copyright: Alessandro Grassani for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Egg Donation and Freezing;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Women and Girls;Babies and Infants;In Vitro Fertilization;Research;Fertility and Sterility (Journal)
results.title: ‘Sobering’ Study Shows Challenges of Egg Freezing
results.abstract: Data from a fertility center showed many women did not get pregnant because of the age at which they froze their eggs and because they did not preserve enough of them.

media.caption: Eggs under a microscope at a fertility clinic in Maryland. “I always tell patients, ‘There’s not a baby in the freezer. There’s a chance to get pregnant,’ ” said one fertility expert.
media.copyright: Andre Chung for The Washington Post, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Law and Legislation;Decisions and Verdicts;Brnovich, Mark;Ducey, Doug (1964- );Planned Parenthood Federation of America;Arizona
results.title: Arizona Judge Reinstates Strict Abortion Ban From 1864
results.abstract: A 15-week abortion ban passed this year will take effect on Saturday. But the attorney general has argued that the near-total ban from the 19th century should take precedence.

media.caption: Attorney General Mark Brnovich of Arizona applauded the judge’s decision.
media.copyright: Alberto Mariani/The Republic, via USA Today Network

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Pop and Rock Music;Folk Music;Post, Jim (1939-2022);Conn, Cathy;Friend & Lover (Music Group)
results.title: Jim Post, Known for a Memorably ‘Groovy’ Hit Song, Dies at 82
results.abstract: He and his wife, Cathy Conn, had a Top 10 single with “Reach Out of the Darkness” as Friend & Lover in 1968. It’s still played today, but it was their only hit.

media.caption: Jim Post and his wife, Cathy Conn, better known as Friend & Lover, had only one Top 10 hit. But it remained a notable part of Mr. Post’s life for 54 years.

results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi and Jane Arraf
results.title: Iran Protests Surge to Dozens of Cities
results.abstract: Iranians fed up with oppressive rules and a battered economy have faced bullets, tear gas and arrests to demand an end to the Islamic Republic’s rule.

results.title: Lost Hope of Lasting Democratic Majority
results.abstract: Revisiting an influential book and the notion that demographics are destiny.

media.caption: Barack Obama on the campaign trail in 2008, when a book titled “The Emerging Democratic Majority” seemed prophetic.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Putin, Vladimir V;Zelensky, Volodymyr;Russia;Kherson (Ukraine);Ukraine
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt and Michael Schwirtz
results.title: As Russian Losses Mount in Ukraine, Putin Gets More Involved in War Strategy
results.abstract: The Russian president has rejected requests from commanders in the field that they be allowed to retreat from Kherson, a vital city in Ukraine’s south.

media.caption: Ukrainian soldiers operate a drone near Kherson, in southern Ukraine. It was the first major city to fall to the Russians in the initial invasion, and remains the only regional capital under Moscow’s control.
media.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

results.abstract: In testimony in a Connecticut trial to assess the damages done by his Sandy Hook lies, the Infowars fabulist lashed out.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Kidnapping and Hostages;United States Politics and Government;Elections, Governors;Dixon, Tudor;Whitmer, Gretchen;Michigan
results.title: Democrats Swiftly Condemn Dixon for Mocking Whitmer Kidnapping Plot
results.abstract: A 2020 kidnapping plot against Gov. Gretchen Whitmer rattled Michigan. On Friday, her Republican opponent, Tudor Dixon, used it as a punchline in two campaign stops.

media.caption: Tudor Dixon took the stage at the Conservative Political Action Coalition in Dallas last month. She is running against Gov. Gretchen Whitmer of Michigan, a Democrat.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.title: Federer, Even in Defeat, Gets Fitting End to Storied Career
results.abstract: Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal were defeated by Jack Sock and Frances Tiafoe in a tight Laver Cup match that included plenty of highlights and fond sentiments.
